course_main_structural_unit.address:
Näituse 2
50409 Tartu linn, 
Tartu linn, Tartumaa 
EST

description.en: The course provides an opportunity to understand the importance of healthy, seasonal, local, and sustainable food choices and to promote these values based on scientific evidence. The course also offers a chance to participate in an intercultural collaborative project and to develop skills in teamwork and effective presentation techniques.
description.et: Kursus pakub võimalust õppida mõistma tervislike, hooajaliste, kohalike ja jätkusuutlike toiduvalikute tähtsust ning neid väärtusi tõenduspõhiselt edendama. Kursus annab ka võimaluse osaleda kultuuridevahelises ühisprojektis ning arendada meeskonnatöö ja tõhusate esitluste tegemise oskusi

objectives.en: The objective of this course is to acquire the skills and knowledge necessary to plan and implement nutrition-related health promotion interventions. During the course, dietetics students from Leuven University of Applied Sciences and from University of Navarra, and students from the University of Tartu will work together to promote healthy and sustainable dietary choices to larger target groups through a variety of activities.
objectives.et: Kursuse eesmärk on omandada oskusi ja teadmisi toitumisalase tervisedenduse sekkumiste planeerimiseks ja läbiviimiseks. Kursusel õpivad TÜ üliõpilased koos Leuveni Rakenduskõrgkooli dietoloogia ja Navarra Ülikooli üliõpilastega läbi erinevate tegevuste tervislike ja jätkusuutlike toiduvalikute edendamist laiematele sihtrühmadele.

learning_outcomes.en: Upon completing the course, the participant:
1.	Describes and explains the importance of healthy, seasonal, local, and sustainable food.
learning_outcomes.et: 1.	Kirjeldab ja selgitab tervisliku, hooajalise, kohaliku ja kestliku toidu olulisust.

learning_outcomes.en: 2.	Explains and illustrates science based strategies for supporting healthy and sustainable food choices.
learning_outcomes.et: 2.	Selgitab ja illustreerib tervislike ja jätkusuutlike toiduvalikute toetamise teaduspõhiseid strateegiaid.

learning_outcomes.en: 3.	Has integrated knowledge and skills from different cultures into the course's group work.
learning_outcomes.et: 3.	On integreerinud kursuse rühmatöösse erinevatest kultuuridest pärit teadmisi ja oskusi.

learning_outcomes.en: 4.	Has created visual materials (photo reportages, videos, etc.) and presentations reflecting nutrition-related health promotion.
learning_outcomes.et: 4.	On loonud visuaalseid materjale (foto reportaaže, videosid jne) ning esitlusi, mis peegeldavad toitumisalast tervisedendust.

independent_work.et: Presentation. The project will result in practical output such as a photo reportage, video, reel, flyer, folder, poster or social media campaign to promote healthy food choices in different target groups. Each student team will present a summary of their project, including the objectives, activities, outcomes, and recommendations for future projects.

grade_evaluation.et: The summary presentation includes the objectives, activities, and outcomes of the project, and recommendations for future projects. The project clearly reflects evidence-based principles of health promotion.

structural_unit.address:
Näituse 2
50409 Tartu linn, 
Tartu linn, Tartumaa 
EST

description.et: Participants will be divided into four student teams. Each team prepares a 7-10-minute interactive presentation on one topic. Presentations are scheduled Nov 4th. (Preparation takes approximately 4 hours)
Introduction. Students' presentations (both universities); forming groups (3 hours 9:00-12:30). Location: Näituse 2-112
Topics of the projects. Preliminary work on the project. Preparation of shopping list: “a healthy twist on a typical Estonian dish” (2 hours 14:00-15:45). Location: Näituse 2-113
Lecture by prof Uku Vainik: Why do we eat so much? Ideas and tips to be used in the project. Groupwork on project, preparation of ideas (3 hours - 9:00-12:00). Location: Näituse 2-112

Excursion to Viinamärdi cheese production facility. Preordered bus leaves from Näituse 2 parking lot at 13:30 and arrives ca 16:15. Groupwork on project, preparation of ideas (3 hours - 13:30-16:15). Location: Viinamärdi talu
After that, in Tartu ca 17:00-18:00, Grocery shopping together for the nextday`s cooking.
Cooking healthy Estonian meal together; eating together. Photography and videography for the project (4 hours - 8:00-12:00). Location: VOCO, Kopli 1, Tartu
Working on the project (3 hours - 13:00-16:30). Location: Näituse 2-113
Presentations of projects. Final conclusions and remarks (3 hours 9:00-12:00). Location: Näituse 2-102

audience.et: Psühholoogia 3. a bakalaureuseõppe ja magistriõppe üliõpilased, kes soovivad õppida tervisliku toitumise edendamise strateegiaid ja osaleda rahvusvahelises üliõpilasprojektis.
